description: Lower bound on cumulative mean of distances between cards after n shuffles in A024222.
references: Martin Gardner, "Card Shuffles," Mathematical Carnival, chapter 10, pages 123-138. New York: Vintage Books, 1977.
Tim Folger, "Shuffling Into Hyperspace," Discover, 1991 (vol 12, no 1), pages 66-67.
example: a(6)=2. Without cut, after shuffle 1 (s1), order is 4 1 5 2 6 3; after s2, 2 4 6 1 3 5; after s3, 1 2 3 4 5 6. Mean distances between cards after s1 = 3.4 (17/5), s2 = 2.6 (13/5), s3 = 1 (5/5). 35/15=2.3, cumulative mean distance, so lower bound is 2. (Cuts change number of shuffles required to return cards to original order, in this case from 3 to 4.)
author: _Enoch Haga_
